Interfaces, Classes, Traits and Enums

cache_loader
Cache Loader.
cache_loader_with_locking
Cache Loader supporting locking.
cache_is_lockable
Cache store feature: locking
cache_is_key_aware
Cache store feature: key awareness.
cache_is_searchable
Cache store feature: keys are searchable.
cache_is_configurable
Cache store feature: configurable.
cache_data_source
Cache Data Source.
cacheable_object
Cacheable object.
cache_lock_interface
Cache lock interface
cache_store_interface
Cache store interface.
title
content_item_readonly_repository_interface
part_of_admin_tree
Interface for anything appearing in the admin tree
parentable_part_of_admin_tree
Interface implemented by any part_of_admin_tree that has children.
behat_session_interface
The Interface for a behat root context.
lock_factory
Defines abstract factory class for generating locks.
manager
Interface describing log readers.
reader
sql_internal_table_reader
Sql internal table reader.
sql_reader
Log iterator reader interface.
issuer_interface
Interface for services, with the methods to be implemented by all the issuer implementing it.
named_templatable
A subset of templatable which provides the name of the template to use.
url_rewriter
URL rewriter interface
core_string_manager
Interface for string manager
task_logger
Interface for task logging.
renderable
Interface marking other classes as suitable for renderer_base::render()
templatable
Interface marking other classes having the ability to export their data for use by templates.
renderer_factory
A renderer factory is just responsible for creating an appropriate renderer for any given part of Moodle.
purge_caches
Form for selecting which caches to purge on admin/purgecaches.php
testoutgoingmailconf_form
Test mail form
setting_scheduled_task_status
This admin setting tells whether a given scheduled task is enabled, providing a link to its configuration page.
mnet_simple_host_form
The very basic first step add new host form - just wwwroot & application The second form is loaded up with the information from this one.
mnet_review_host_form
The second step of the form - reviewing the host details This is also the same form that is used for editing an existing host
mnet_profile_form
small form to allow the administrator to configure (override) which profile fields are sent/imported over mnet
mnet_services_form
Wrapper that separates quickforms syntax from moodle code
set_block_protection_test
Unit tests to test block protection changes.
set_plugin_order_test
Unit tests to configure the plugin order.
set_plugin_state_test
Unit tests to configure the enabled/disabled state of a plugin.
user_bulk_cohortadd_form
Wrapper that separates quickforms syntax from moodle code
user_bulk_action_form
Bulk user action form
user_bulk_form
Bulk user form
test_site_users_analyser
Test analyser
time_splittings_test
Unit tests for core time splitting methods.
base_converter
Base converter class
convert_exception
General convert-related exception
imscc1_converter
Base converter class
imscc1_convert_exception
Exception thrown by this converter
imscc11_export_converter
Base converter class
imscc11_store_backup_file
Abstract class defining the needed stuff to execute code on backup
imscc11_zip_contents
Abstract class defining the needed stuff to execute code on backup
imscc11_backup_convert
Abstract class defining the needed stuff to execute code on backup
imscc11_converter
Base converter class
imscc11_convert_exception
Exception thrown by this converter
test_backup_cron_automated_helper
New backup_cron_automated_helper class for testing.
convert_factory
Factory class to create new instances of backup converters
async_helper
Helper functions for asynchronous backups and restores.
backup_cron_automated_helper
This class is an abstract class with methods that can be called to aid the running of automated backups over cron.
convert_helper
Provides various functionality via its static methods
convert_helper_exception
General convert_helper related exception
alignment_form
Form to edit alignment.
core_badges_assertion
Class that represents badge assertion.
badge
Class that represents badge.
backpack
Form to edit backpack initial details.
badge
Form to edit badge details.
collections
Form to select backpack collections.
message
Form to edit badge message.
helper
Badge helper library.
badge_alignments
Link to external resources this badge is aligned with.
badge_collection
Collection of all badges for view.php page
badge_management
Collection of badges used at the index.php page
badge_recipients
Badge recipients rendering class
badge_related
Collection of all related badges.
badge_user_collection
Collection of user badges used at the mybadges.php page
external_badge
An external badges for external.php page
issued_badge
An issued badges for badge.php page
award_criteria
Award criteria abstract definition
award_criteria_activity
Badge award criteria -- award on activity completion
award_criteria_course
Badge award criteria -- award on course completion
award_criteria_courseset
Badge award criteria -- award on courseset completion
award_criteria_manual
Manual badge award criteria
award_criteria_overall
Overall badge award criteria
award_criteria_profile
Profile completion badge award criteria
edit_criteria_form
Form to edit badge criteria.
endorsement_form
Form to edit endorsement.
badge_award_selector_base
Base class for user selectors.
badge_potential_users_selector
A user selector control for potential users to award badge
badge_existing_users_selector
A user selector control for existing users to award badge
PNG_MetaDataHandler
Information on PNG file chunks can be found at http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11Chunks Some other info on PNG that I used http://garethrees.org/2007/11/14/pngcrush/
badges_preferences_form
Wrapper that separates quickforms syntax from moodle code
edit_relatedbadge_form
Form to edit badge details.
core_badges_renderer
Standard HTML output renderer for badges
badgeslib_test
Advanced PHPUnit test case customised for Moodle.
administration_helper
Administration helper base class.
cache_config
Cache configuration reader.
cache_definition
The cache definition class.
cachestore_dummy
The cache dummy store.
cache_factory
The cache factory class.
cache_helper
The cache helper class.
cache
The main cache class.
administration_display_helper
A cache helper for administration tasks
cache_store
Abstract cache store class.
cache_disabled
The cache loader class used when the Cache has been disabled.
cache_factory_disabled
The cache factory class used when the Cache has been disabled.
cache_config_disabled
The cache config class used when the Cache has been disabled.
cachestore_addinstance_form
Add store instance form.
cache_definition_mappings_form
Form to set definition mappings
cache_definition_sharing_form
Form to set definition sharing option
cache_mode_mappings_form
Form to set the mappings for a mode.
cache_lock_form
Form to add a cache lock instance.
cache_cached_object
A cached object wrapper.
cache_ttl_wrapper
A wrapper class used to handle ttl when the cache store doesn't natively support it.
cache_exception
A cache exception class. Just allows people to catch cache exceptions.
cacheable_object_array
An array of cacheable objects.
cache_config_writer
Cache configuration writer.
cache_test
PHPunit tests for the cache API
cache_config_testing
Override the default cache configuration for our own maniacal purposes.
cache_phpunit_dummy_object
Dummy object for testing cacheable object interface and interaction
cache_phpunit_dummy_datasource
Dummy data source object for testing data source interface and implementation
cache_phpunit_application
PHPUnit application cache loader.
cache_phpunit_session
PHPUnit session cache loader.
cache_phpunit_request
PHPUnit request cache loader.
cache_phpunit_dummy_overrideclass
Dummy overridden cache loader class that we can use to test overriding loader functionality.
cache_phpunit_factory
Cache PHPUnit specific factory.
cache_phpunit_cache
Cache PHPUnit specific Cache helper.
cachestore_tests
An abstract class to make writing unit tests for cache stores very easy.
comment
Comment is helper class to add/delete comments anywhere in moodle
comment_exception
Comment exception class
activities_due
Activities due indicator.
content_item
The content_item class.
lang_string_title
The lang_string_title class of value object, providing access to the value of a lang string.
string_title
The string_title class of value object, which provides access to a simple string.
course_content_item_exporter
The course_content_item_exporter class.
course_content_items_exporter
The course_content_items_exporter class.
caching_content_item_readonly_repository
The class caching_content_item_repository, for fetching content_items, with additional caching.
content_item_readonly_repository
The class content_item_repository, for reading content_items.
content_item_service
The content_item_service class, providing the api for interacting with content items.
category_action_bar
Class responsible for generating the action bar (tertiary nav) elements in an individual category page
manage_categories_action_bar
Class responsible for generating the action bar (tertiary nav) elements in the category management page
dndupload_handler
Stores all the information about the available dndupload handlers
dndupload_ajax_processor
Processes the upload, creating the course module and returning the result
coursecat_helper
Class storing display options and functions to help display course category and/or courses lists
course_reset_form
Defines the course reset settings form.
caching_content_item_readonly_repository_test
The test class for the caching_content_item_readonly_repository class.
content_item_readonly_repository_test
The test class for the content_item_readonly_repository class.
exporters_content_item_test
The tests for the course_content_item_exporter class.
exporters_content_items_test
The tests for the course_content_items_exporter class.
search_test
Provides the unit tests for course global search.
services_content_item_service_test
The tests for the content_item_service class.
enrollib_test
Test non-plugin enrollib parts.
filter_local_settings_form
Wrapper that separates quickforms syntax from moodle code
geoip_test
GeoIp data file parsing test.
geoplugin_test
GeoIp data file parsing test.
admin_category
The object used to represent folders (a.k.a. categories) in the admin tree block.
admin_root
Root of admin settings tree, does not have any parent.
admin_externalpage
Links external PHP pages into the admin tree.
admin_settingdependency
Used to store details of the dependency between two settings elements.
admin_settingpage
Used to group a number of admin_setting objects into a page and add them to the admin tree.
admin_setting
Admin settings class. Only exists on setting pages.
admin_setting_flag
An additional option that can be applied to an admin setting.
admin_setting_heading
No setting - just heading and text.
admin_setting_description
No setting - just name and description in same row.
admin_setting_configtext
The most flexible setting, the user enters text.
admin_setting_configtext_with_maxlength
Text input with a maximum length constraint.
admin_setting_configtextarea
General text area without html editor.
admin_setting_confightmleditor
General text area with html editor.
admin_setting_configpasswordunmask
Password field, allows unmasking of password
admin_setting_configpasswordunmask_with_advanced
Password field, allows unmasking of password, with an advanced checkbox that controls an additional $name.'_adv' setting.
admin_setting_encryptedpassword
Admin setting class for encrypted values using secure encryption.
admin_setting_configempty
Empty setting used to allow flags (advanced) on settings that can have no sensible default.
admin_setting_configfile
Path to directory
admin_setting_configexecutable
Path to executable file
admin_setting_configdirectory
Path to directory

Used to validate a textarea used for ip addresses

Loads/stores oauth2 access tokens in DB for system accounts in order to use a single token across multiple sessions.
api
Static list of api methods for system oauth2 configuration.
clever
Class clever - Custom client handler to fetch data from Clever
linkedin
Class linkedin - Custom client handler to fetch data from linkedin
client
Configurable oauth2 client class. URLs come from DB and access tokens from either DB (system accounts) or session (users').
auth_server_config_reader
Simple reader class, allowing OAuth 2 Authorization Server Metadata to be read from an auth server's well-known.
base_definition
Class for provider discovery definition, to allow services easily discover and process information.
imsbadgeconnect
Class for IMS Open Badge Connect API (aka OBv2.1) discovery definition.
openidconnect
Class for Open ID Connect discovery definition.
endpoint
Class for loading/storing oauth2 endpoints from the DB
issuer
Class for loading/storing issuer from the DB
refresh_system_tokens_task
Task to refresh system tokens regularly. Admins are notified in case an authorisation expires.
rest
Rest API base class mapping rest api methods to endpoints with http methods, args and post body.
rest_exception
Rest Exception class containing error code and message.
clever
Class for Clever OAuth service, with the specific methods related to it.
custom
Class for Custom services, with the specific methods related to it.
facebook
Class for Facebook oAuth service, with the specific methods related to it.
google
Class for Google oAuth service, with the specific methods related to it.
imsobv2p1
Class for IMS Open Badges v2.1 oAuth service, with the specific methods related to it.
linkedin
Class linkedin.
microsoft
Class for Microsoft oAuth service, with the specific methods related to it.
moodlenet
MoodleNet OAuth 2 configuration.
nextcloud
Class for Nextcloud oAuth service, with the specific methods related to it.
system_account
Class for loading/storing oauth2 refresh tokens from the DB.
user_field_mapping
Class for loading/storing oauth2 user field mappings from the DB

mustache_user_date_helper
Mustache helper that will convert a timestamp to a date string.

filter_manager
Class to manage the filtering of strings. It is intended that this class is only used by weblib.php. Client code should probably be using the format_text and format_string functions.
null_filter_manager
Filter manager subclass that does nothing. Having this simplifies the logic of format_text, etc.
performance_measuring_filter_manager
Filter manager subclass that tracks how much work it does.
moodle_text_filter
Base class for text filters. You just need to override this class and implement the filter method.
filterobject
This is just a little object to define a phrase and some instructions for how to process it. Filters can create an array of these to pass to the @{link filter_phrases()} function below.

Information about a course that is cached in the course table 'modinfo' field (and then in memory) in order to reduce the need for other database queries.

When user disappears from external source, user enrolment is suspended, roles are kept as is.

When user disappears from external source, the enrolment is suspended and roles assigned by enrol instance are removed. Please note that user may "disappear" from gradebook and other areas.
ENROL_EXT_REMOVED_UNENROL  = 0
When user disappears from external source, the enrolment is completely removed

URL_MATCH_BASE  = 0
A moodle_url comparison using this flag will return true if the base URLs match, params are ignored.
URL_MATCH_EXACT  = 2
A moodle_url comparison using this flag will return true if the two URLs are identical, except for the order of the params.
URL_MATCH_PARAMS  = 1
A moodle_url comparison using this flag will return true if the base URLs match and the params of url1 are part of url2.

Returns SQL used to search through user table to find users (in a query which may also join and apply other conditions).
users_order_by_sql()  : array<string|int, mixed>
This function generates the standard ORDER BY clause for use when generating lists of users. If you don't have a reason to use a different order, then you should use this method to generate the order when displaying lists of users.

ldap_paged_results_supported()  : bool
Check if we can use paged results (see RFC 2696). We need to use LDAP version 3 (or later), otherwise the server cannot use them. If we also pass in a valid LDAP connection handle, we also check whether the server actually supports them.

question_move_questions_to_category()  : bool
This function should be considered private to the question bank, it is called from question/editlib.php question/contextmoveq.php and a few similar places to to the work of actually moving questions and associated data. However, callers of this function also have to do other work, which is why you should not call this method directly from outside the questionbank.

question_preload_questions()  : array<string|int, mixed>
Given a list of ids, load the basic information about a set of questions from the questions table. The $join and $extrafields arguments can be used together to pull in extra data. See, for example, the usage in {@see \mod_quiz\quiz_attempt}, and read the code below to see how the SQL is assembled. Throws exceptions on error.
question_load_questions()  : array<string|int, mixed>|string
Load a set of questions, given a list of ids. The $join and $extrafields arguments can be used together to pull in extra data. See, for example, the usage in mod/quiz/attempt.php, and read the code below to see how the SQL is assembled. Throws exceptions on error.

sesskey()  : string
Makes sure that $USER->sesskey exists, if $USER itself exists. It sets a new sesskey if one does not already exist, but does not overwrite existing sesskeys. Returns the sesskey string if $USER exists, or boolean false if not.

replace_ampersands_not_followed_by_entity()  : string
Given a string, performs a negative lookahead looking for any ampersand character that is not followed by a proper HTML entity. If any is found, it is replaced by &amp;. The string is then returned.

CLI_SCRIPT

fix_orphaned_calendar_events.php : 42

Fix orphaned calendar events that were broken by MDL-67494.

public mixed CLI_SCRIPT = \true

This script will look for all the calendar events which userids where broken by a wrong upgrade step, affecting to Moodle 3.9.5 and up.

It performs checks to both: a) Detect if the site was affected (ran the wrong upgrade step). b) Look for orphaned calendar events, categorising them as: - standard: site / category / course / group / user events - subscription: events created via subscriptions. - action: normal action events, created to show common important dates. - override: user and group override events, particular, that some activities support. - custom: other events, not being any of the above, common or particular. By specifying it (--fix) try to recover as many broken events (missing userid) as possible. Standard, subscription, action, override events in core are fully supported but override or custom events should be fixed by each plugin as far as there isn't any standard API (plugin-wise) to launch a rebuild of the calendar events.

Tags
copyright

2021 onwards Simey Lameze simey@moodle.com

license

https://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html GNU GPL v3 or later

is_dataroot_insecure()

adminlib.php : 540

Try to verify that dataroot is not accessible from web.

is_dataroot_insecure([bool $fetchtest = false ]) : mixed

Try to verify that dataroot is not accessible from web. It is not 100% correct but might help to reduce number of vulnerable sites. Protection from httpd.conf and .htaccess is not detected properly.

Parameters
$fetchtest : bool = false

try to test public access by fetching file, default false

Tags
uses
INSECURE_DATAROOT_WARNING
uses
INSECURE_DATAROOT_ERROR
Return values
mixed —

empty means secure, INSECURE_DATAROOT_ERROR found a critical problem, INSECURE_DATAROOT_WARNING might be problematic

admin_externalpage_setup()

adminlib.php : 8571

Initialise admin page - this function does require login and permission checks specified in page definition.

admin_externalpage_setup(string $section[, string $extrabutton = '' ][, array<string|int, mixed> $extraurlparams = null ][, string $actualurl = '' ][, array<string|int, mixed> $options = array() ]) : mixed

This function must be called on each admin page before other code.

Parameters
$section : string

name of page

$extrabutton : string = ''

extra HTML that is added after the blocks editing on/off button.

$extraurlparams : array<string|int, mixed> = null

an array paramname => paramvalue, or parameters that need to be added to the turn blocks editing on/off form, so this page reloads correctly.

$actualurl : string = ''

if the actual page being viewed is not the normal one for this page (e.g. admin/roles/allow.php, instead of admin/roles/manage.php, you can pass the alternate URL here.

$options : array<string|int, mixed> = array()

Additional options that can be specified for page setup. pagelayout - This option can be used to set a specific pagelyaout, admin is default. nosearch - Do not display search bar

Tags
global

moodle_page $PAGE

Return values
mixed —

admin_apply_default_settings()

adminlib.php : 8730

This function applies default settings.

admin_apply_default_settings([mixed $node = null ][, bool $unconditional = true ][, array<string|int, mixed> $admindefaultsettings = array() ][, array<string|int, mixed> $settingsoutput = array() ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Because setting the defaults of some settings can enable other settings, this function is called recursively until no more new settings are found.

Parameters
$node : mixed = null
$unconditional : bool = true

if true overrides all values with defaults, true by default

$admindefaultsettings : array<string|int, mixed> = array()

default admin settings to apply. Used recursively

$settingsoutput : array<string|int, mixed> = array()

The names and values of the changed settings. Used recursively

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

$settingsoutput The names and values of the changed settings

mixed —

The id or false if it doesn't exist.

css_send_uncached_css()

csslib.php : 168

Sends CSS directly without caching it.

css_send_uncached_css(string $css) : mixed

This function takes a raw CSS string, optimises it if required, and then serves it. Turning both themedesignermode and CSS optimiser on at the same time is awful for performance because of the optimiser running here. However it was done so that theme designers could utilise the optimised output during development to help them optimise their CSS... not that they should write lazy CSS.

Parameters
$css : string
Return values
mixed —

Search through course users

search_users(int $courseid, int $groupid, string $searchtext[, string $sort = '' ][, array<string|int, mixed> $exceptions = null ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Tags
global

object

uses
SITEID
uses
SQL_PARAMS_NAMED
uses
CONTEXT_COURSE
Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

users_search_sql()

datalib.php : 230

Returns SQL used to search through user table to find users (in a query which may also join and apply other conditions).

users_search_sql(string $search[, string $u = 'u' ][, bool $searchanywhere = true ][, array<string|int, mixed> $extrafields = [] ][, array<string|int, mixed> $exclude = null ][, array<string|int, mixed> $includeonly = null ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

You can combine this SQL with an existing query by adding 'AND $sql' to the WHERE clause of your query (where $sql is the first element in the array returned by this function), and merging in the $params array to the parameters of your query (where $params is the second element). Your query should use named parameters such as :param, rather than the question mark style.

There are examples of basic usage in the unit test for this function.

Parameters
$search : string

the text to search for (empty string = find all)

$u : string = 'u'

the table alias for the user table in the query being built. May be ''.

$searchanywhere : bool = true

If true (default), searches in the middle of names, otherwise only searches at start

$extrafields : array<string|int, mixed> = []

Array of extra user fields to include in search, must be prefixed with table alias if they are not in the user table.

$exclude : array<string|int, mixed> = null

Array of user ids to exclude (empty = don't exclude)

$includeonly : array<string|int, mixed> = null

If specified, only returns users that have ids incldued in this array (empty = don't restrict)

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

an array with two elements, a fragment of SQL to go in the where clause the query, and an associative array containing any required parameters (using named placeholders).

users_order_by_sql()

datalib.php : 346

This function generates the standard ORDER BY clause for use when generating lists of users. If you don't have a reason to use a different order, then you should use this method to generate the order when displaying lists of users.

users_order_by_sql([string $usertablealias = '' ][, string $search = null ][, context|null $context = null ][, array<string|int, mixed> $customfieldmappings = [] ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

If the optional $search parameter is passed, then exact matches to the search will be sorted first. For example, suppose you have two users 'Al Zebra' and 'Alan Aardvark'. The default sort is Alan, then Al. If, however, you search for 'Al', then Al will be listed first. (With two users, this is not a big deal, but with thousands of users, it is essential.)

The list of fields scanned for exact matches are:

  • firstname
  • lastname
  • $DB->sql_fullname
  • those returned by \core_user\fields::get_identity_fields or those included in $customfieldmappings

If named parameters are used (which is the default, and highly recommended), then the parameter names are like :usersortexactN, where N is an int.

The simplest possible example use is: list($sort, $params) = users_order_by_sql(); $sql = 'SELECT * FROM {users} ORDER BY ' . $sort;

A more complex example, showing that this sort can be combined with other sorts: list($sort, $sortparams) = users_order_by_sql('u'); $sql = "SELECT g.id AS groupid, gg.groupingid, u.id AS userid, u.firstname, u.lastname, u.idnumber, u.username FROM {groups} g LEFT JOIN {groupings_groups} gg ON g.id = gg.groupid LEFT JOIN {groups_members} gm ON g.id = gm.groupid LEFT JOIN {user} u ON gm.userid = u.id WHERE g.courseid = :courseid $groupwhere $groupingwhere ORDER BY g.name, $sort"; $params += $sortparams;

An example showing the use of $search: list($sort, $sortparams) = users_order_by_sql('u', $search, $this->get_context()); $order = ' ORDER BY ' . $sort; $params += $sortparams; $availableusers = $DB->get_records_sql($fields . $sql . $order, $params, $page*$perpage, $perpage);

Parameters
$usertablealias : string = ''

(optional) any table prefix for the {users} table. E.g. 'u'.

$search : string = null

(optional) a current search string. If given, any exact matches to this string will be sorted first.

$context : context|null = null

the context we are in. Used by \core_user\fields::get_identity_fields. Defaults to $PAGE->context.

$customfieldmappings : array<string|int, mixed> = []

associative array of mappings for custom fields returned by \core_user\fields::get_sql.

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

with two elements: string SQL fragment to use in the ORDER BY clause. For example, "firstname, lastname". array of parameters used in the SQL fragment. If $search is not given, this is guaranteed to be an empty array.

get_users()

datalib.php : 415

Returns a subset of users

get_users([bool $get = true ][, string $search = '' ][, bool $confirmed = false ][, array<string|int, mixed> $exceptions = null ][, string $sort = 'firstname ASC' ][, string $firstinitial = '' ][, string $lastinitial = '' ][, string $page = '' ][, string $recordsperpage = '' ][, string $fields = '*' ][, mixed $extraselect = '' ][, array<string|int, mixed> $extraparams = null ]) : array<string|int, mixed>|int|bool

Return values
array<string|int, mixed>|int|bool —

records unless get is false in which case the integer count of the records found is returned. False is returned if an error is encountered.

get_courses()

datalib.php : 635

Returns list of courses, for whole site, or category

get_courses([string|int $categoryid = "all" ][, string $sort = "c.sortorder ASC" ][, string $fields = "c.*" ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Returns list of courses, for whole site, or category Important: Using c.* for fields is extremely expensive because we are using distinct. You almost NEVER need all the fields in such a large SELECT

Consider using core_course_category::get_courses() or core_course_category::search_courses() instead since they use caching.

Parameters
$categoryid : string|int = "all"

Either a category id or 'all' for everything

$sort : string = "c.sortorder ASC"

A field and direction to sort by

$fields : string = "c.*"

The additional fields to return (note that "id, category, visible" are always present)

datalib.php : 1466

Determine whether a module instance is visible within a course

instance_is_visible( $moduletype,  $module) : bool

Given a valid module object with info about the id and course, and the module's type (eg "forum") returns whether the object is visible or not according to the 'eye' icon only.

NOTE: This does NOT take into account visibility to a particular user. To get visibility access for a specific user, use get_fast_modinfo, get a cm_info object from this, and check the ->uservisible property; or use the \core_availability\info_module::is_user_visible() static function.

update_field_with_unique_index()

datalib.php : 1747

This method can update the values in mulitple database rows for a colum with a unique index, without violating that constraint.

update_field_with_unique_index(string $table, string $field, array<string|int, mixed> $newvalues, array<string|int, mixed> $otherconditions[, int $unusedvalue = -1 ]) : mixed

Suppose we have a table with a unique index on (otherid, sortorder), and for a particular value of otherid, we want to change all the sort orders. You have to do this carefully or you will violate the unique index at some time. This method takes care of the details for you.

Note that, it is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that the requested rename is legal. For example, if you ask for [1 => 2, 2 => 2] then you will get a unique key violation error from the database.

Parameters
$table : string

The database table to modify.

$field : string

the field that contains the values we are going to change.

$newvalues : array<string|int, mixed>

oldvalue => newvalue how to change the values. E.g. [1 => 4, 2 => 1, 3 => 3, 4 => 2].

$otherconditions : array<string|int, mixed>

array fieldname => requestedvalue extra WHERE clause conditions to restrict which rows are affected. E.g. array('otherid' => 123).

$unusedvalue : int = -1

(defaults to -1) a value that is never used in $ordercol.

Return values
mixed —

decompose_update_into_safe_changes()

datalib.php : 1783

Helper used by {@link update_field_with_unique_index()}. Given a desired set of changes, break them down into single udpates that can be done one at a time without breaking any unique index constraints.

decompose_update_into_safe_changes(array<string|int, mixed> $newvalues, int $unusedvalue) : array<string|int, mixed>

Suppose the input is array(1 => 2, 2 => 1) and -1. Then the output will be array (array(1, -1), array(2, 1), array(-1, 2)). This function solves this problem in the general case, not just for simple swaps. The unit tests give more examples.

Note that, it is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that the requested rename is legal. For example, if you ask for something impossible like array(1 => 2, 2 => 2) then the results are undefined. (You will probably get a unique key violation error from the database later.)

Parameters
$newvalues : array<string|int, mixed>

The desired re-ordering. E.g. array(1 => 4, 2 => 1, 3 => 3, 4 => 2).

$unusedvalue : int

A value that is not currently used.

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

A safe way to perform the re-order. An array of two-element arrays array($from, $to). E.g. array(array(1, -1), array(2, 1), array(4, 2), array(-1, 4)).

get_max_courses_in_category()

get_max_courses_in_category() : int

uses
MAX_COURSES_IN_CATEGORY
Return values

number of courses

get_safe_orderby()

datalib.php : 1891

Prepare a safe ORDER BY statement from user interactable requests.

get_safe_orderby(array<string|int, mixed> $orderbymap, string $orderbykey[, string $direction = '' ][, bool $useprefix = true ]) : string

This allows safe user specified sorting (ORDER BY), by abstracting the SQL from the value being requested by the user. A standard string (and optional direction) can be specified, which will be mapped to a predefined allow list of SQL ordering. The mapping can optionally include a 'default', which will be used if the key provided is invalid.

Example usage: -If $orderbymap = [ 'courseid' => 'c.id', 'somecustomvalue'=> 'c.startdate, c.shortname', 'default' => 'c.fullname', ] -A value from the map array's keys can be passed in by a user interaction (eg web service) along with an optional direction. -get_safe_orderby($orderbymap, 'courseid', 'DESC') would return: ORDER BY c.id DESC -get_safe_orderby($orderbymap, 'somecustomvalue') would return: ORDER BY c.startdate, c.shortname -get_safe_orderby($orderbymap, 'invalidblah', 'DESC') would return: ORDER BY c.fullname DESC -If no default key was specified in $orderbymap, the invalidblah example above would return empty string.

Parameters
$orderbymap : array<string|int, mixed>

An array in the format [keystring => sqlstring]. A default fallback can be set with the key 'default'.

$orderbykey : string

A string to be mapped to a key in $orderbymap.

$direction : string = ''

Optional ORDER BY direction (ASC/DESC, case insensitive).

$useprefix : bool = true

Whether ORDER BY is prefixed to the output (true by default). This should not be modified in most cases. It is included to enable get_safe_orderby_multiple() to use this function multiple times.

Return values
string —

The ORDER BY statement, or empty string if $orderbykey is invalid and no default is mapped.

get_safe_orderby_multiple()

datalib.php : 1938

Prepare a safe ORDER BY statement from user interactable requests using multiple values.

get_safe_orderby_multiple(array<string|int, mixed> $orderbymap, array<string|int, mixed> $orderbykeys[, array<string|int, mixed> $directions = [] ]) : string

This allows safe user specified sorting (ORDER BY) similar to get_safe_orderby(), but supports multiple keys and directions. This is useful in cases where combinations of columns are needed and/or each item requires a specified direction (ASC/DESC). The mapping can optionally include a 'default', which will be used if the key provided is invalid.

Example usage: -If $orderbymap = [ 'courseid' => 'c.id', 'fullname'=> 'c.fullname', 'default' => 'c.startdate', ] -An array of values from the map's keys can be passed in by a user interaction (eg web service), with optional directions. -get_safe_orderby($orderbymap, ['courseid', 'fullname'], ['DESC', 'ASC']) would return: ORDER BY c.id DESC, c.fullname ASC -get_safe_orderby($orderbymap, ['courseid', 'invalidblah'], ['aaa', 'DESC']) would return: ORDER BY c.id, c.startdate DESC -If no default key was specified in $orderbymap, the invalidblah example above would return: ORDER BY c.id

Parameters
$orderbymap : array<string|int, mixed>

An array in the format [keystring => sqlstring]. A default fallback can be set with the key 'default'.

$orderbykeys : array<string|int, mixed>

An array of strings to be mapped to keys in $orderbymap.

$directions : array<string|int, mixed> = []

Optional array of ORDER BY direction (ASC/DESC, case insensitive). The array keys should match array keys in $orderbykeys.

Return values
string —

The ORDER BY statement, or empty string if $orderbykeys contains no valid items and no default is mapped.

setup_DB()

dmllib.php : 290

Sets up global $DB moodle_database instance

setup_DB() : void|bool
Tags
global

stdClass $CFG The global configuration instance.

global

stdClass $DB The global moodle_database instance.

see

config.php

see

config-dist.php

Return values

This function calls enrol_get_shared_courses() setting checkexistsonly to true.

$user2 : stdClass|int

enrol_get_shared_courses()

enrollib.php : 300

Returns any courses shared by the two users

enrol_get_shared_courses(stdClass|int $user1, stdClass|int $user2[, bool $preloadcontexts = false ][, bool $checkexistsonly = false ]) : array<string|int, mixed>|bool

The courses has to be visible and enrolments has to be active, timestart and timeend restrictions are ignored.

Parameters
$user1 : stdClass|int
$user2 : stdClass|int
$preloadcontexts : bool = false

If set to true contexts for the returned courses will be preloaded.

$checkexistsonly : bool = false

If set to true then this function will return true if the users share any courses and false if not.

Tags
global

moodle_database $DB

Return values
array<string|int, mixed>|bool —

An array of courses that both users are enrolled in OR if $checkexistsonly set returns true if the users share any courses and false if not.

enrol_get_my_courses()

enrollib.php : 584

Returns list of courses current $USER is enrolled in and can access

enrol_get_my_courses([string|array<string|int, mixed> $fields = null ][, string|null $sort = null ], int $limit[, array<string|int, mixed> $courseids = [] ][, bool $allaccessible = false ], int $offset[, array<string|int, mixed> $excludecourses = [] ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

The $fields param is a list of field names to ADD so name just the fields you really need, which will be added and uniq'd.

If $allaccessible is true, this will additionally return courses that the current user is not enrolled in, but can access because they are open to the user for other reasons (course view permission, currently viewing course as a guest, or course allows guest access without password).

Parameters
$fields : string|array<string|int, mixed> = null

Extra fields to be returned (array or comma-separated list).

$sort : string|null = null

Comma separated list of fields to sort by, defaults to respecting navsortmycoursessort. Allowed prefixes for sort fields are: "ul" for the user_lastaccess table, "c" for the courses table, "ue" for the user_enrolments table.

$limit : int

max number of courses

$courseids : array<string|int, mixed> = []

the list of course ids to filter by

$allaccessible : bool = false

Include courses user is not enrolled in, but can access

$offset : int

Offset the result set by this number

$excludecourses : array<string|int, mixed> = []

IDs of hidden courses to exclude from search

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

get_enrolled_with_capabilities_join()

enrollib.php : 1471

Returns an array of joins, wheres and params that will limit the group of users to only those enrolled and with given capability (if specified).

get_enrolled_with_capabilities_join(context $context[, string $prefix = '' ][, string|array<string|int, mixed> $capability = '' ], int|array<string|int, mixed> $groupids[, bool $onlyactive = false ][, bool $onlysuspended = false ], int $enrolid) : sql_join

Note this join will return duplicate rows for users who have been enrolled several times (e.g. as manual enrolment, and as self enrolment). You may need to use a SELECT DISTINCT in your query (see get_enrolled_sql for example).

In case is guaranteed some of the joins never match any rows, the resulting join_sql->cannotmatchanyrows will be true. This happens when the capability is prohibited.

Parameters
$context : context
$prefix : string = ''

optional, a prefix to the user id column

$capability : string|array<string|int, mixed> = ''

optional, may include a capability name, or array of names. If an array is provided then this is the equivalent of a logical 'OR', i.e. the user needs to have one of these capabilities.

$groupids : int|array<string|int, mixed>

The groupids, 0 or [] means all groups and USERSWITHOUTGROUP no group

$onlyactive : bool = false

consider only active enrolments in enabled plugins and time restrictions

$onlysuspended : bool = false

inverse of onlyactive, consider only suspended enrolments

$enrolid : int

The enrolment ID. If not 0, only users enrolled using this enrolment method will be returned.

Return values
sql_join —

Contains joins, wheres, params and cannotmatchanyrows

This function is using 'eu[0-9]+_' prefix for table names and parameters.

Parameters
$context : context
$withcapability : string = ''
$groupids : int|array<string|int, mixed>

The groupids, 0 or [] means all groups and USERSWITHOUTGROUP no group

$onlyactive : bool = false

consider only active enrolments in enabled plugins and time restrictions

$onlysuspended : bool = false

inverse of onlyactive, consider only suspended enrolments

$enrolid : int

The enrolment ID. If not 0, only users enrolled using this enrolment method will be returned.

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

list($sql, $params)

environmentlib.php : 95

This function checks all the requirements defined in environment.xml.

check_moodle_environment(string $version[, int $env_select = ENV_SELECT_NEWER ]) : array<string|int, mixed>
Parameters
$version : string

version to check.

$env_select : int = ENV_SELECT_NEWER

one of ENV_SELECT_NEWER | ENV_SELECT_DATAROOT | ENV_SELECT_RELEASE decide xml to use. Default ENV_SELECT_NEWER (BC)

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

with two elements. The first element true/false, depending on on whether the check passed. The second element is an array of environment_results objects that has detailed information about the checks and which ones passed.

$env_select : int|string

one of ENV_SELECT_NEWER | ENV_SELECT_DATAROOT | ENV_SELECT_RELEASE decide xml to use. String means plugin name.

Tags
uses
NO_VERSION_DATA_FOUND
Return values
object —

results encapsulated in one environment_result object

process_environment_bypass()

environmentlib.php : 1109

This function will post-process the result record by executing the specified function, modifying it as necessary, also a custom message will be added to the result object to be printed by the display layer.

process_environment_bypass(mixed $xml, mixed &$result) : void

Every bypass function must be defined in this file and it'll return true/false to decide if the original test is bypassed or no. Also such bypass functions are able to directly handling the result object although it should be only under exceptional conditions.

Parameters
$xml : mixed
$result : mixed
Return values
void —

$result : mixed

filter_get_all_local_settings()

filterlib.php : 992

This function is for use by backup. Gets all the filter information specific to one context.

filter_get_all_local_settings(int $contextid) : array<string|int, mixed>
Parameters
$contextid : int
Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

Array with two elements. The first element is an array of objects with fields filter and active. These come from the filter_active table. The second element is an array of objects with fields filter, name and value from the filter_config table.

filter_get_active_in_context()

filterlib.php : 1012

Get the list of active filters, in the order that they should be used for a particular context, along with any local configuration variables.

filter_get_active_in_context(context $context) : array<string|int, mixed>
Parameters
$context : context

a context

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

an array where the keys are the filter names, for example 'tex' and the values are any local configuration for that filter, as an array of name => value pairs from the filter_config table. In a lot of cases, this will be an empty array. So, an example return value for this function might be array(tex' => array())

Parameters
$context : context

a context that is not the system context.

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

an array with filter names, for example 'tex' as keys. and and the values are objects with fields: ->filter filter name, same as the key. ->localstate TEXTFILTER_ON/OFF/INHERIT ->inheritedstate TEXTFILTER_ON/OFF - the state that will be used if localstate is set to TEXTFILTER_INHERIT.

filter_save_ignore_tags()

filterlib.php : 1557

Extract open/lose tags and their contents to avoid being processed by filters.

filter_save_ignore_tags(string &$text, array<string|int, mixed> $filterignoretagsopen, array<string|int, mixed> $filterignoretagsclose, array<string|int, mixed> &$ignoretags) : mixed

Useful to extract pieces of code like ... tags. It returns the text converted with some <#xTEXTFILTER_EXCL_SEPARATORx#> codes replacing the extracted text. Such extracted texts are returned in the ignoretags array (as values), with codes as keys.

Parameters
$text : string

the text that we are filtering (in/out)

$filterignoretagsopen : array<string|int, mixed>

an array of open tags to start searching

$filterignoretagsclose : array<string|int, mixed>

an array of close tags to end searching

$ignoretags : array<string|int, mixed>

an array of saved strings useful to rebuild the original text (in/out)

Return values
mixed —

Parameters

the text that we are filtering (in/out)

$tags : array<string|int, mixed>

imagecopybicubic()

gdlib.php : 48

Copies a rectangular portion of the source image to another rectangle in the destination image

imagecopybicubic(resource|GdImage $dst_img, resource|GdImage $src_img, int $dst_x, int $dst_y, int $src_x, int $src_y, int $dst_w, int $dst_h, int $src_w, int $src_h) : bool

This function calls imagecopyresampled() if it is available and GD version is 2 at least. Otherwise it reimplements the same behaviour. See the PHP manual page for more info.

Parameters
$dst_img : resource|GdImage

the destination GD image resource

$src_img : resource|GdImage

the source GD image resource

$dst_x : int

vthe X coordinate of the upper left corner in the destination image

$dst_y : int

the Y coordinate of the upper left corner in the destination image

$src_x : int

the X coordinate of the upper left corner in the source image

$src_y : int

the Y coordinate of the upper left corner in the source image

$dst_w : int

the width of the destination rectangle

$dst_h : int

the height of the destination rectangle

$src_w : int

the width of the source rectangle

$src_h : int

the height of the source rectangle

Tags
link
http://php.net/manual/en/function.imagecopyresampled.php
Return values
bool —

tru on success, false otherwise

process_new_icon()

gdlib.php : 104

Stores optimised icon images in icon file area.

process_new_icon(context $context, string $component, mixed $filearea, int $itemid, string $originalfile[, bool $preferpng = false ]) : mixed

Since 2.9 this function will generate an icon in the same format as the original file when possible. To counter that behaviour, you can use the argument $preferpng to generate a PNG icon.

Parameters
$context : context
$component : string
$filearea : mixed
$itemid : int
$originalfile : string
$preferpng : bool = false

When true, it will try to generate a PNG file regardless of the original file.

Return values
mixed —

new unique revision number or false if not saved

resize_image()

gdlib.php : 294

Resize an image from an image path.

resize_image(string $filepath, int|null $width, int|null $height[, bool $forcecanvas = false ]) : string|bool

This maintains the aspect ratio of the image. This will not enlarge the image.

Parameters
$filepath : string

The full path to the original image file.

$width : int|null

The max width of the resized image, or null to only use the height.

$height : int|null

The max height of the resized image, or null to only use the width.

$forcecanvas : bool = false

Whether the final dimensions should be set to $width and $height.

Return values
string|bool —

False if a problem occurs, else the resized image data.

resize_image_from_image()

Resize an image from an image object.

resize_image_from_image(resource|GdImage $original, array<string|int, mixed> $imageinfo, int|null $width, int|null $height[, bool $forcecanvas = false ]) : string|bool
Parameters
$original : resource|GdImage

The image to work on.

$imageinfo : array<string|int, mixed>

Contains [0] => originalwidth, [1] => originalheight.

$width : int|null

The max width of the resized image, or null to only use the height.

$height : int|null

The max height of the resized image, or null to only use the width.

$forcecanvas : bool = false

Whether the final dimensions should be set to $width and $height.

Return values
string|bool —

False if a problem occurs, else the resized image data.

generate_image_thumbnail()

gdlib.php : 428

Generates a thumbnail for the given image

generate_image_thumbnail(string $filepath, int $width, int $height) : string|bool

If the GD library has at least version 2 and PNG support is available, the returned data is the content of a transparent PNG file containing the thumbnail. Otherwise, the function returns contents of a JPEG file with black background containing the thumbnail.

Parameters
$filepath : string

the full path to the original image file

$width : int

the width of the requested thumbnail

$height : int

the height of the requested thumbnail

Return values
string|bool —

false if a problem occurs, the thumbnail image data otherwise

Parameters

The image content as a string

$width : int

the width of the requested thumbnail

$height : int

the height of the requested thumbnail

Return values
string|bool —

false if a problem occurs, the thumbnail image data otherwise

If the GD library has at least version 2 and PNG support is available, the returned data is the content of a transparent PNG file containing the thumbnail. Otherwise, the function returns contents of a JPEG file with black background containing the thumbnail.

Contains [0] => originalwidth, [1] => originalheight.

mb_internal_encoding()

override.php : 47

Set the encoding to be used by our monkey patched mb_ functions.

mb_internal_encoding([string $encoding = null ]) : mixed

When called with $encoding !== null, we set the static $intenalencoding variable, which is used for subsequent calls.

When called with no value for $encoding, we return the previously defined $internalencoding.

This is necessary as we need to maintain the state of mb_internal_encoding across calls to other mb_* functions. Check how it is used in the other mb_* functions defined here - if no encoding is provided we fallback to what was set here, otherwise we used the given encoding.

Parameters
$encoding : string = null

When given, sets $internalencoding

Tags
staticvar

string $internalencoding The encoding to be used across mb_* calls.

Return values
mixed —

mb_substr()

override.php : 77

Performs a multi-byte safe substr() operation based on number of characters.

mb_substr(string $str, int $start[, int $length = null ][, string $encoding = null ]) : string

Position is counted from the beginning of str. First character's position is 0. Second character position is 1, and so on.

Parameters
$str : string

The string to extract the substring from.

$start : int

If start is non-negative, the returned string will start at the start'th position in string, counting from zero. For instance, in the string 'abcdef', the character at position 0 is 'a', the character at position 2 is 'c', and so forth.

$length : int = null

Maximum number of characters to use from str. If omitted or NULL is passed, extract all characters to the end of the string.

$encoding : string = null

The encoding parameter is the character encoding. If it is omitted, the internal character encoding value will be used.

Return values
string —

The portion of str specified by the start and length parameters.

mb_strlen()

override.php : 95

Gets the length of a string.

mb_strlen(string $str[, string $encoding = null ]) : int
Parameters
$str : string

The string being checked for length.

$encoding : string = null

The encoding parameter is the character encoding. If it is omitted, the internal character encoding value will be used.

Return values
int —

The number of characters in str having character encoding $encoding. A multibyte character is counted as 1.

mb_strtolower()

override.php : 112

Returns $str with all alphabetic chatacters converted to lowercase.

mb_strtolower(string $str[, string $encoding = null ]) : string
Parameters
$str : string

The string being lowercased.

$encoding : string = null

The encoding parameter is the character encoding. If it is omitted, the internal character encoding value will be used.

Return values
string —

The string with all alphabetic characters converted to lowercase.

$encoding : string = null

The encoding parameter is the character encoding. If it is omitted, the internal character encoding value will be used.

ldap_connect_moodle()

ldaplib.php : 182

Tries connect to specified ldap servers. Returns a valid LDAP connection or false.

ldap_connect_moodle(string $host_url, int $ldap_version, string $user_type, string $bind_dn, string $bind_pw, bool $opt_deref, string &$debuginfo[, bool $start_tls = false ]) : mixed
Parameters
$host_url : string
$ldap_version : int

either 2 (LDAPv2) or 3 (LDAPv3).

$user_type : string

the configured user type for this connection.

$bind_dn : string

the binding user dn. If an emtpy string, anonymous binding is used.

$bind_pw : string

the password for the binding user. Ignored for anonymous bindings.

$opt_deref : bool

whether to set LDAP_OPT_DEREF on this connection or not.

$debuginfo : string

the debugging information in case the connection fails.

$start_tls : bool = false

whether to use LDAP with TLS (not to be confused with LDAP+SSL)

Return values
mixed —

connection result or false.

The order of the special characters in these arrays _IS IMPORTANT_.

ldap_get_dn_special_chars() : mixed

Make sure '\5C' (and '\') are the first elements of the arrays. Otherwise we'll double replace '' with '\5C' which is Bad(tm)

ldap_paged_results_supported()

ldaplib.php : 475

Check if we can use paged results (see RFC 2696). We need to use LDAP version 3 (or later), otherwise the server cannot use them. If we also pass in a valid LDAP connection handle, we also check whether the server actually supports them.

ldap_paged_results_supported(mixed $ldapversion[, mixed $ldapconnection = null ]) : bool
Parameters
$ldapversion : mixed
$ldapconnection : mixed = null
Return values

get_fast_modinfo()

modinfolib.php : 2536

Returns reference to full info about modules in course (including visibility).

get_fast_modinfo(int|stdClass $courseorid, int $userid[, bool $resetonly = false ]) : course_modinfo|null

Cached and as fast as possible (0 or 1 db query).

use get_fast_modinfo($courseid, 0, true) to reset the static cache for particular course use get_fast_modinfo(0, 0, true) to reset the static cache for all courses

use rebuild_course_cache($courseid, true) to reset the application AND static cache for particular course when it's contents has changed

Parameters
$courseorid : int|stdClass

object from DB table 'course' (must have field 'id' and recommended to have field 'cacherev') or just a course id. Just course id is enough when calling get_fast_modinfo() for current course or site or when calling for any other course for the second time.

$userid : int

User id to populate 'availble' and 'uservisible' attributes of modules and sections. Set to 0 for current user (default). Set to -1 to avoid calculation of dynamic user-depended data.

$resetonly : bool = false

whether we want to get modinfo or just reset the cache

Tags
throws
moodle_exception

when course is not found (nothing is thrown if resetting)

Return values
course_modinfo|null —

Module information for course, or null if resetting

get_course_and_cm_from_cmid()

modinfolib.php : 2588

Efficiently retrieves the $course (stdclass) and $cm (cm_info) objects, given a cmid. If module name is also provided, it will ensure the cm is of that type.

get_course_and_cm_from_cmid(stdClass|int $cmorid[, string $modulename = '' ], stdClass|int $courseorid, int $userid) : array<string|int, mixed>

Usage: list($course, $cm) = get_course_and_cm_from_cmid($cmid, 'forum');

Using this method has a performance advantage because it works by loading modinfo for the course - which will then be cached and it is needed later in most requests. It also guarantees that the $cm object is a cm_info and not a stdclass.

The $course object can be supplied if already known and will speed up this function - although it is more efficient to use this function to get the course if you are starting from a cmid.

To avoid security problems and obscure bugs, you should always specify $modulename if the cmid value came from user input.

By default this obtains information (for example, whether user can access the activity) for current user, but you can specify a userid if required.

Parameters
$cmorid : stdClass|int

Id of course-module, or database object

$modulename : string = ''

Optional modulename (improves security)

$courseorid : stdClass|int

Optional course object if already loaded

$userid : int

Optional userid (default = current)

Tags
throws
moodle_exception

If the item doesn't exist or is of wrong module name

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

Array with 2 elements $course and $cm

get_course_and_cm_from_instance()

modinfolib.php : 2664

Efficiently retrieves the $course (stdclass) and $cm (cm_info) objects, given an instance id or record and module name.

get_course_and_cm_from_instance(stdclass|int $instanceorid, string $modulename, stdClass|int $courseorid, int $userid) : array<string|int, mixed>

Usage: list($course, $cm) = get_course_and_cm_from_instance($forum, 'forum');

Using this method has a performance advantage because it works by loading modinfo for the course - which will then be cached and it is needed later in most requests. It also guarantees that the $cm object is a cm_info and not a stdclass.

The $course object can be supplied if already known and will speed up this function - although it is more efficient to use this function to get the course if you are starting from an instance id.

By default this obtains information (for example, whether user can access the activity) for current user, but you can specify a userid if required.

Parameters
$instanceorid : stdclass|int

Id of module instance, or database object

$modulename : string

Modulename (required)

$courseorid : stdClass|int

Optional course object if already loaded

$userid : int

Optional userid (default = current)

Tags
throws
moodle_exception

If the item doesn't exist or is of wrong module name

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

Array with 2 elements $course and $cm

rebuild_course_cache()

modinfolib.php : 2745

Rebuilds or resets the cached list of course activities stored in MUC.

rebuild_course_cache(int $courseid[, bool $clearonly = false ][, bool $partialrebuild = false ]) : void

rebuild_course_cache() must NEVER be called from lib/db/upgrade.php. At the same time course cache may ONLY be cleared using this function in upgrade scripts of plugins.

During the bulk operations if it is necessary to reset cache of multiple courses it is enough to call for the table 'course' and field 'cacherev' specifying affected courses in select.

Cached course information is stored in MUC core/coursemodinfo and is validated with the DB field {course}.cacherev

Parameters
$courseid : int

id of course to rebuild, empty means all

$clearonly : bool = false

only clear the cache, gets rebuild automatically on the fly. Recommended to set to true to avoid unnecessary multiple rebuilding.

$partialrebuild : bool = false

will not delete the whole cache when it's true. use purge_module_cache() or purge_section_cache() must be called before when partialrebuild is true. use purge_module_cache() to invalidate mod cache. use purge_section_cache() to invalidate section cache.

Tags
global

moodle_database $DB

throws
coding_exception
Return values
void —

question_reorder_qtypes()

questionlib.php : 74

Move one question type in a list of question types. If you try to move one element off of the end, nothing will change.

question_reorder_qtypes(array<string|int, mixed> $sortedqtypes, string $tomove, int $direction) : array<string|int, mixed>
Parameters
$sortedqtypes : array<string|int, mixed>

An array $qtype => anything.

$tomove : string

one of the keys from $sortedqtypes

$direction : int

+1 or -1

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

an array $index => $qtype, with $index from 0 to n in order, and the $qtypes in the same order as $sortedqtypes, except that $tomove will have been moved one place.

match_grade_options()

questionlib.php : 196

Check whether a given grade is one of a list of allowed options. If not, depending on $matchgrades, either return the nearest match, or return false to signal an error.

Parameters

list of valid options

$grade : int

grade to be tested

$matchgrades : string = 'error'

'error' or 'nearest'

Return values

question_move_question_tags_to_new_context()

questionlib.php : 573

This function will handle moving all tag instances to a new context for a given list of questions.

question_move_question_tags_to_new_context(array<string|int, stdClass> $questions, context $newcontext) : void

Questions can be tagged in up to two contexts: 1.) The context the question exists in. 2.) The course context (if the question context is a higher context. E.g. course category context or system context.

This means a question that exists in a higher context (e.g. course cat or system context) may have multiple groups of tags in any number of child course contexts.

Questions in the course category context can be move "down" a context level into one of their child course contexts or activity contexts which affects the availability of that question in other courses / activities.

In this case it makes the questions no longer available in the other course or activity contexts so we need to make sure that the tag instances in those other contexts are removed.

Parameters
$questions : array<string|int, stdClass>

The list of question being moved (must include the id and contextid)

$newcontext : context

The Moodle context the questions are being moved to

Return values
void —

idnumber_exist_in_question_category()

question_preload_questions()

questionlib.php : 866

Given a list of ids, load the basic information about a set of questions from the questions table. The $join and $extrafields arguments can be used together to pull in extra data. See, for example, the usage in {@see \mod_quiz\quiz_attempt}, and read the code below to see how the SQL is assembled. Throws exceptions on error.

question_preload_questions([array<string|int, mixed> $questionids = null ][, string $extrafields = '' ][, string $join = '' ][, array<string|int, mixed> $extraparams = [] ][, string $orderby = '' ]) : array<string|int, mixed>
Parameters
$questionids : array<string|int, mixed> = null

array of question ids to load. If null, then all questions matched by $join will be loaded.

$extrafields : string = ''

extra SQL code to be added to the query.

$join : string = ''

extra SQL code to be added to the query.

$extraparams : array<string|int, mixed> = []

values for any placeholders in $join. You must use named placeholders.

$orderby : string = ''

what to order the results by. Optional, default is unspecified order.

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

partially complete question objects. You need to call get_question_options on them before they can be properly used.

questionlib.php : 931

Load a set of questions, given a list of ids. The $join and $extrafields arguments can be used together to pull in extra data. See, for example, the usage in mod/quiz/attempt.php, and read the code below to see how the SQL is assembled. Throws exceptions on error.

question_load_questions(array<string|int, mixed> $questionids[, string $extrafields = '' ][, string $join = '' ]) : array<string|int, mixed>|string
Parameters
$questionids : array<string|int, mixed>

array of question ids.

$extrafields : string = ''

extra SQL code to be added to the query.

$join : string = ''

extra SQL code to be added to the query.

Return values

question objects.

question_pluginfile()

questionlib.php : 1763

Called by pluginfile.php to serve files related to the 'question' core component and for files belonging to qtypes.

question_pluginfile(stdClass $course, stdClass $context, string $component, string $filearea, array<string|int, mixed> $args, bool $forcedownload[, array<string|int, mixed> $options = [] ]) : array<string|int, mixed>|bool

For files that relate to questions in a question_attempt, then we delegate to a function in the component that owns the attempt (for example in the quiz, or in core question preview) to get necessary inforation.

(Note that, at the moment, all question file areas relate to questions in attempts, so the If at the start of the last paragraph is always true.)

Does not return, either calls send_file_not_found(); or serves the file.

Parameters
$course : stdClass

course settings object

$context : stdClass

context object

$component : string

the name of the component we are serving files for.

$filearea : string

the name of the file area.

$args : array<string|int, mixed>

the remaining bits of the file path.

$forcedownload : bool

whether the user must be forced to download the file.

$options : array<string|int, mixed> = []

additional options affecting the file serving

Tags
category

files

Return values
array<string|int, mixed>|bool —

core_question_find_next_unused_idnumber()

questionlib.php : 1990

If $oldidnumber ends in some digits then return the next available idnumber of the same form.

core_question_find_next_unused_idnumber(string|null $oldidnumber, int $categoryid) : string|null

So idnum -> null (no digits at the end) idnum0099 -> idnum0100 (if that is unused, else whichever of idnum0101, idnume0102, ... is unused. idnum9 -> idnum10.

Parameters
$oldidnumber : string|null

a question idnumber, or can be null.

$categoryid : int

a question category id.

Return values
string|null —

suggested new idnumber for a question in that category, or null if one cannot be found.

question_remove_stale_questions_from_category()

questionlib.php : 2218

Remove stale questions from a category.

question_remove_stale_questions_from_category(int $categoryid) : mixed

While questions should not be left behind when they are not used any more, it does happen, maybe via restore, or old logic, or uncovered scenarios. When this happens, the users are unable to delete the question category unless they move those stale questions to another one category, but to them the category is empty as it does not contain anything. The purpose of this function is to detect the questions that may have gone stale and remove them.

You will typically use this prior to checking if the category contains questions.

The stale questions (unused and hidden to the user) handled are:

  • hidden questions
  • random questions
Parameters
$categoryid : int

The category ID.

Tags

flatten_category_tree()

questionlib.php : 2244

Private method, only for the use of add_indented_names().

flatten_category_tree(array<string|int, mixed> &$categories, int $id, int $depth[, int $nochildrenof = -1 ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Recursively adds an indentedname field to each category, starting with the category with id $id, and dealing with that category and all its children, and return a new array, with those categories in the right order.

Parameters
$categories : array<string|int, mixed>

an array of categories which has had childids fields added by flatten_category_tree(). Passed by reference for performance only. It is not modfied.

$id : int

the category to start the indenting process from.

$depth : int

the indent depth. Used in recursive calls.

$nochildrenof : int = -1
Tags
deprecated

since Moodle 4.0 MDL-71585

see
helper
todo

Final deprecation on Moodle 4.4 MDL-72438

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

a new array of categories, in the right order for the tree.

confirm_sesskey()

sessionlib.php : 65

Check the sesskey and return true of false for whether it is valid.

confirm_sesskey([string $sesskey = NULL ]) : bool

(You might like to imagine this function is called sesskey_is_valid().)

Every script that lets the user perform a significant action (that is, changes data in the database) should check the sesskey before doing the action. Depending on your code flow, you may want to use the helper function.

Parameters
$sesskey : string = NULL

The sesskey value to check (optional). Normally leave this blank and this function will do required_param('sesskey', ...).

Return values
bool —

whether the sesskey sent in the request matches the one stored in the session.

is_early_init()

setuplib.php : 461

This function encapsulates the tests for whether an exception was thrown in early init -- either during setup.php or during init of $OUTPUT.

is_early_init(array<string|int, mixed> $backtrace) : bool

If another exception is thrown then, and if we do not take special measures, we would just get a very cryptic message "Exception thrown without a stack frame in Unknown on line 0". That makes debugging very hard, so we do take special measures in default_exception_handler, with the help of this function.

Parameters
$backtrace : array<string|int, mixed>

the stack trace to analyse.

Return values
bool —

whether the stack trace is somewhere in output initialisation.

Return values
mixed —

get_docs_url()

setuplib.php : 631

Returns the Moodle Docs URL in the users language for a given 'More help' link.

get_docs_url([string $path = null ]) : string

There are three cases:

  1. In the normal case, $path will be a short relative path 'component/thing', like 'mod/folder/view' 'group/import'. This gets turned into an link to MoodleDocs in the user's language, and for the appropriate Moodle version. E.g. 'group/import' may become 'http://docs.moodle.org/2x/en/group/import'. The 'http://docs.moodle.org' bit comes from $CFG->docroot.

This is the only option that should be used in standard Moodle code. The other two options have been implemented because they are useful for third-party plugins.

  1. $path may be an absolute URL, starting http:// or https://. In this case, the link is used as is.

  2. $path may start %%WWWROOT%%, in which case that is replaced by $CFG->wwwroot to make the link.

Parameters
$path : string = null

the place to link to. See above for details.

Return values
string —

The MoodleDocs URL in the user's language. for example @link http://docs.moodle.org/2x/en/$path}

format_backtrace()

setuplib.php : 689

Formats a backtrace ready for output.

format_backtrace(array<string|int, mixed> $callers[, bool $plaintext = false ]) : string

This function does not include function arguments because they could contain sensitive information not suitable to be exposed in a response.

Parameters
$callers : array<string|int, mixed>

backtrace array, as returned by debug_backtrace().

$plaintext : bool = false

if false, generates HTML, if true generates plain text.

Return values
string —

formatted backtrace, ready for output.

during_initial_install()

setuplib.php : 1220

Indicates whether we are in the middle of the initial Moodle install.

during_initial_install() : bool

Very occasionally it is necessary avoid running certain bits of code before the Moodle installation has completed. The installed flag is set in admin/index.php after Moodle core and all the plugins have been installed, but just before the person doing the initial install is asked to choose the admin password.

Return values
bool —

true if the initial install is not complete.

raise_memory_limit()

setuplib.php : 1238

Function to raise the memory limit to a new value.

raise_memory_limit(mixed $newlimit) : bool

Will respect the memory limit if it is higher, thus allowing settings in php.ini, apache conf or command line switches to override it.

The memory limit should be expressed with a constant MEMORY_STANDARD, MEMORY_EXTRA or MEMORY_HUGE. It is possible to use strings or integers too (eg:'128M').

Parameters
$newlimit : mixed

the new memory limit

Return values
bool —

success

The memory limit should be expressed with a string (eg:'64M')

Parameters
$newlimit : string

the new memory limit

check_dir_exists()

setuplib.php : 1489

Function to check if a directory exists and by default create it if not exists.

check_dir_exists(string $dir[, bool $create = true ][, bool $recursive = true ]) : bool

Previously this was accepting paths only from dataroot, but we now allow files outside of dataroot if you supply custom paths for some settings in config.php. This function does not verify that the directory is writable.

NOTE: this function uses current file stat cache, please use clearstatcache() before this if you expect that the directories may have been removed recently from a different request.

Parameters
$dir : string

absolute directory path

$create : bool = true

directory if does not exist

$recursive : bool = true

create directory recursively

Return values
bool —

true if directory exists or created, false otherwise

make_request_directory()

setuplib.php : 1697

Create a per-request directory and make sure it is writable.

make_request_directory([bool $exceptiononerror = true ][, bool $forcecreate = false ]) : string

This can only be used during the current request and will be tidied away automatically afterwards.

A new, unique directory is always created within a shared base request directory.

In some exceptional cases an alternative base directory may be required. This can be accomplished using the $forcecreate parameter. Typically this will only be requried where the file may be required during a shutdown handler which may or may not be registered after a previous request directory has been created.

Parameters
$exceptiononerror : bool = true

throw exception if error encountered

$forcecreate : bool = false

Force creation of a new parent directory

Return values
string —

The full path to directory if successful, false if not; may throw exception

make_backup_temp_directory()

setuplib.php : 1727

Create a directory under $CFG->backuptempdir and make sure it is writable.

make_backup_temp_directory(string $directory[, bool $exceptiononerror = true ]) : string|false

Do not use for storing generic temp files - see make_temp_directory() instead for this purpose.

Backup temporary files must be on a shared storage.

Parameters
$directory : string

the relative path of the directory to be created under $CFG->backuptempdir

$exceptiononerror : bool = true

throw exception if error encountered

Return values
string|false —

Returns full path to directory if successful, false if not; may throw exception

make_temp_directory()

setuplib.php : 1754

Create a directory under tempdir and make sure it is writable.

make_temp_directory(string $directory[, bool $exceptiononerror = true ]) : string|false

Where possible, please use make_request_directory() and limit the scope of your data to the current HTTP request.

Do not use for storing cache files - see make_cache_directory(), and make_localcache_directory() instead for this purpose.

Temporary files must be on a shared storage, and heavy usage is discouraged due to the performance impact upon clustered environments.

Parameters
$directory : string

the full path of the directory to be created under $CFG->tempdir

$exceptiononerror : bool = true

throw exception if error encountered

Return values
string|false —

Returns full path to directory if successful, false if not; may throw exception

make_cache_directory()

setuplib.php : 1774

Create a directory under cachedir and make sure it is writable.

make_cache_directory(string $directory[, bool $exceptiononerror = true ]) : string|false

Note: this cache directory is shared by all cluster nodes.

Parameters
$directory : string

the full path of the directory to be created under $CFG->cachedir

$exceptiononerror : bool = true

throw exception if error encountered

Return values
string|false —

Returns full path to directory if successful, false if not; may throw exception

make_localcache_directory()

setuplib.php : 1799

Create a directory under localcachedir and make sure it is writable.

make_localcache_directory(string $directory[, bool $exceptiononerror = true ]) : string|false

The files in this directory MUST NOT change, use revisions or content hashes to work around this limitation - this means you can only add new files here.

The content of this directory gets purged automatically on all cluster nodes after calling purge_all_caches() before new data is written to this directory.

Note: this local cache directory does not need to be shared by cluster nodes.

Parameters
$directory : string

the relative path of the directory to be created under $CFG->localcachedir

$exceptiononerror : bool = true

throw exception if error encountered

Return values
string|false —

Returns full path to directory if successful, false if not; may throw exception

Add http stream instrumentation

proxy_log_callback(array<string|int, mixed> $code) : mixed

This detects which any reads or writes to a php stream which uses the 'http' handler. Ideally 100% of traffic uses the Moodle curl libraries which do not use php streams.

Parameters

indicates if the soap messages should be saved (i.e. if get_soap_messages is used) and should be used only for debugging

testing_cli_fix_directory_separator()

lib.php : 279

Fix DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR for windows.

testing_cli_fix_directory_separator(string $path) : string

In PHP on Windows, DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR is set to the backslash () character. However, if you're running a Cygwin/Msys/Git shell exec() calls will return paths using the forward slash (/) character.

NOTE: Because PHP on Windows will accept either forward or backslashes, paths should be built using ONLY forward slashes, regardless of OS. MOODLE_DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR should only be used when parsing paths returned by the shell.

Parameters
$path : string
Return values
string —

upgrade_main_savepoint()

upgradelib.php : 337

Upgrade savepoint, marks end of each upgrade block.

upgrade_main_savepoint(bool $result, mixed $version[, bool $allowabort = true ]) : void

It stores new main version, resets upgrade timeout and abort upgrade if user cancels page loading.

Please do not make large upgrade blocks with lots of operations, for example when adding tables keep only one table operation per block.

Parameters
$result : bool

false if upgrade step failed, true if completed

$version : mixed
$allowabort : bool = true

allow user to abort script execution here

Tags
category

upgrade

Return values
void —

true means borked upgrade, false means previous PHP files were properly removed
