check_igbinary322_version()

upgradelib.php : 2518

Check if the igbinary extension installed is buggy one

check_igbinary322_version(environment_results $result) : environment_results|null

There are a few php-igbinary versions that are buggy and return any unserialised array with wrong index. This defeats key() and next() operations on them.

This library is used by MUC and also by memcached and redis when available.

Let's inform if there is some problem when:

  • php 7.2 is being used (php 7.3 and up are immune).
  • the igbinary extension is installed.
  • the version of the extension is between 3.2.2 and 3.2.4.
  • the buggy behaviour is reproduced.
Parameters
$result : environment_results

object to update, if relevant.

Return values
environment_results|null —

updated results or null.

check_upgrade_key()

upgradelib.php : 2563

Assert the upgrade key is provided, if it is defined.

check_upgrade_key(string|null $upgradekeyhash) : mixed

The upgrade key can be defined in the main config.php as $CFG->upgradekey. If it is defined there, then its value must be provided every time the site is being upgraded, regardless the administrator is logged in or not.

This is supposed to be used at certain places in /admin/index.php only.

Parameters
$upgradekeyhash : string|null

the SHA-1 of the value provided by the user

Return values
mixed —

me() : mixed

format_text()

weblib.php : 1264

Given text in a variety of format codings, this function returns the text as safe HTML.

format_text(string $text[, int $format = FORMAT_MOODLE ][, stdClass|array<string|int, mixed> $options = null ][, int $courseiddonotuse = null ]) : string

This function should mainly be used for long strings like posts, answers, glossary items etc. For short strings .

Options:
     trusted     :   If true the string won't be cleaned. Default false required noclean=true.
     noclean     :   If true the string won't be cleaned, unless $CFG->forceclean is set. Default false required trusted=true.
     nocache     :   If true the strign will not be cached and will be formatted every call. Default false.
     filter      :   If true the string will be run through applicable filters as well. Default true.
     para        :   If true then the returned string will be wrapped in div tags. Default true.
     newlines    :   If true then lines newline breaks will be converted to HTML newline breaks. Default true.
     context     :   The context that will be used for filtering.
     overflowdiv :   If set to true the formatted text will be encased in a div
                     with the class no-overflow before being returned. Default false.
     allowid     :   If true then id attributes will not be removed, even when
                     using htmlpurifier. Default false.
     blanktarget :   If true all  tags will have target="_blank" added unless target is explicitly specified.
Parameters
$text : string

The text to be formatted. This is raw text originally from user input.

$format : int = FORMAT_MOODLE

Identifier of the text format to be used [FORMAT_MOODLE, FORMAT_HTML, FORMAT_PLAIN, FORMAT_MARKDOWN]

$options : stdClass|array<string|int, mixed> = null

text formatting options

$courseiddonotuse : int = null

deprecated course id, use context option instead

Tags
staticvar

array $croncache

Return values
string —

format_string(string $string[, bool $striplinks = true ][, array<string|int, mixed> $options = null ]) : string

clean_text()

weblib.php : 1746

Cleans raw text removing nasties.

clean_text(string $text[, int|string $format = FORMAT_HTML ][, array<string|int, mixed> $options = array() ]) : string

Given raw text (eg typed in by a user) this function cleans it up and removes any nasty tags that could mess up Moodle pages through XSS attacks.

The result must be used as a HTML text fragment, this function can not cleanup random parts of html tags such as url or src attributes.

NOTE: the format parameter was deprecated because we can safely clean only HTML.

Parameters
$text : string

The text to be cleaned

$format : int|string = FORMAT_HTML

deprecated parameter, should always contain FORMAT_HTML or FORMAT_MOODLE

$options : array<string|int, mixed> = array()

Array of options; currently only option supported is 'allowid' (if true, does not remove id attributes when cleaning)

Return values
string —

The cleaned up text

Return values

false means html is safe and valid, true means use HTMLPurifier

text_to_html()

weblib.php : 2002

Given plain text, makes it into HTML as nicely as possible.

text_to_html(string $text[, bool $smileyignored = null ][, bool $para = true ][, bool $newlines = true ]) : string

May contain HTML tags already.

Do not abuse this function. It is intended as lower level formatting feature used by to convert FORMAT_MOODLE to HTML. You are supposed to call format_text() in most of cases.

Parameters
$text : string

The string to convert.

$smileyignored : bool = null

Was used to determine if smiley characters should convert to smiley images, ignored now

$para : bool = true

If true then the returned string will be wrapped in div tags

$newlines : bool = true

If true then lines newline breaks will be converted to HTML newline breaks.

Return values
string —

html_to_text()

weblib.php : 2055

Given HTML text, make it into plain text using external function

html_to_text(string $html[, int $width = 75 ][, bool $dolinks = true ]) : string
Parameters
$html : string

The text to be converted.

$width : int = 75

Width to wrap the text at. (optional, default 75 which is a good value for email. 0 means do not limit line length.)

$dolinks : bool = true

By default, any links in the HTML are collected, and printed as a list at the end of the HTML. If you don't want that, set this argument to false.

Return values
string —

plain text equivalent of the HTML.

content_to_text()

weblib.php : 2087

Converts texts or strings to plain text.

content_to_text(string $content, int|false $contentformat) : string
  • When used to convert user input introduced in an editor the text format needs to be passed in $contentformat like we usually do in format_text.
  • When this function is used for strings that are usually passed through format_string before displaying them we need to set $contentformat to false. This will execute html_to_text as these strings can contain multilang tags if multilang filter is applied to headings.
Parameters
$content : string

The text as entered by the user

$contentformat : int|false

False for strings or the text format: FORMAT_MOODLE/FORMAT_HTML/FORMAT_PLAIN/FORMAT_MARKDOWN

Return values
string —

Plain text.

Factory method for extracting draft file links from arbitrary text using regular expressions. Only text is required; other file fields may be passed to filter.

extract_draft_file_urls_from_text(string $text[, bool $forcehttps = false ][, int $contextid = null ][, string $component = null ][, string $filearea = null ][, int $itemid = null ][, string $filename = null ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

highlight()

weblib.php : 2176

This function will highlight search words in a given string

highlight(string $needle, string $haystack[, bool $matchcase = false ][, string $prefix = '<span class="highlight">' ][, string $suffix = '</span>' ]) : string

It cares about HTML and will not ruin links. It's best to use this function after performing any conversions to HTML.

Parameters
$needle : string

The search string. Syntax like "word1 +word2 -word3" is dealt with correctly.

$haystack : string

The string (HTML) within which to highlight the search terms.

$matchcase : bool = false

whether to do case-sensitive. Default case-insensitive.

$prefix : string = '<span class="highlight">'

the string to put before each search term found.

$suffix : string = '</span>'

the string to put after each search term found.

Return values
string —

The highlighted HTML.

The string to search for

$haystack : string

The string to search for $needle in

Return values
string —

The highlighted HTML

send_headers()

weblib.php : 2337

Send the HTTP headers that Moodle requires.

send_headers(string $contenttype[, bool $cacheable = true ]) : mixed

There is a backwards compatibility hack for legacy code that needs to add custom IE compatibility directive.

Example: if (!isset($CFG->additionalhtmlhead)) { $CFG->additionalhtmlhead = ''; } $CFG->additionalhtmlhead .= ''; header('X-UA-Compatible: IE=8'); echo $OUTPUT->header();

Please note the $CFG->additionalhtmlhead alone might not work, you should send the IE compatibility header() too.

Parameters
$contenttype : string
$cacheable : bool = true

Can this page be cached on back?

Return values
mixed —

link_arrow_right()

weblib.php : 2383

Return the right arrow with text ('next'), and optionally embedded in a link.

link_arrow_right(string $text[, string $url = '' ][, bool $accesshide = false ][, string $addclass = '' ][, mixed $addparams = [] ]) : string
Parameters
$text : string

HTML/plain text label (set to blank only for breadcrumb separator cases).

$url : string = ''

An optional link to use in a surrounding HTML anchor.

print_collapsible_region()

weblib.php : 2498

Print (or return) a collapsible region, that has a caption that can be clicked to expand or collapse the region.

print_collapsible_region(string $contents, string $classes, string $id, string $caption[, string $userpref = '' ][, bool $default = false ][, bool $return = false ]) : string|void

If JavaScript is off, then the region will always be expanded.

Parameters
$contents : string

the contents of the box.

$classes : string

class names added to the div that is output.

$id : string

id added to the div that is output. Must not be blank.

$caption : string

text displayed at the top. Clicking on this will cause the region to expand or contract.

$userpref : string = ''

the name of the user preference that stores the user's preferred default state. (May be blank if you do not wish the state to be persisted.

$default : bool = false

Initial collapsed state to use if the user_preference it not set.

$return : bool = false

if true, return the HTML as a string, rather than printing it.

Return values
string|void —

If $return is false, returns nothing, otherwise returns a string of HTML.

print_collapsible_region_start()

weblib.php : 2526

Print (or return) the start of a collapsible region

print_collapsible_region_start(string $classes, string $id, string $caption[, string $userpref = '' ][, bool $default = false ][, bool $return = false ][, string $extracontent = null ]) : string|void

The collapsibleregion has a caption that can be clicked to expand or collapse the region. If JavaScript is off, then the region will always be expanded.

Parameters
$classes : string

class names added to the div that is output.

$id : string

id added to the div that is output. Must not be blank.

$caption : string

text displayed at the top. Clicking on this will cause the region to expand or contract.

$userpref : string = ''

the name of the user preference that stores the user's preferred default state. (May be blank if you do not wish the state to be persisted.

$default : bool = false

Initial collapsed state to use if the user_preference it not set.

$return : bool = false

if true, return the HTML as a string, rather than printing it.

$extracontent : string = null

the extra content will show next to caption, eg.Help icon.

Return values
string|void —

if $return is false, returns nothing, otherwise returns a string of HTML.

print_group_picture()

weblib.php : 2592

Print a specified group's avatar.

print_group_picture(array<string|int, mixed>|stdClass $group, int $courseid[, bool $large = false ][, bool $return = false ][, bool $link = true ][, bool $includetoken = false ]) : string|void
Parameters
$group : array<string|int, mixed>|stdClass

A single object OR array of groups.

$courseid : int

The course ID.

$large : bool = false

Default small picture, or large.

$return : bool = false

If false print picture, otherwise return the output as string

$link : bool = true

Enclose image in a link to view specified course?

$includetoken : bool = false

Whether to use a user token when displaying this group image. True indicates to generate a token for current user, and integer value indicates to generate a token for the user whose id is the value indicated. If the group picture is included in an e-mail or some other location where the audience is a specific user who will not be logged in when viewing, then we use a token to authenticate the user.

Return values
string|void —

Depending on the setting of $return

redirect()

weblib.php : 2912

Redirects the user to another page, after printing a notice.

redirect(moodle_url|string $url[, string $message = '' ][, int $delay = null ][, string $messagetype = coreoutput otification::NOTIFY_INFO ]) : mixed

This function calls the OUTPUT redirect method, echo's the output and then dies to ensure nothing else happens.

Good practice: You should call this method before starting page output by using any of the OUTPUT methods.

print_tabs()

weblib.php : 3219

Returns a string containing a nested list, suitable for formatting into tabs with CSS.

print_tabs(array<string|int, mixed> $tabrows[, string $selected = null ][, array<string|int, mixed> $inactive = null ][, array<string|int, mixed> $activated = null ][, bool $return = false ]) : string

It is not recommended to use this function in Moodle 2.5 but it is left for backward compartibility.

Example how to print a single line tabs: $rows = array( new tabobject(...), new tabobject(...) ); echo $OUTPUT->tabtree($rows, $selectedid);

Multiple row tabs may not look good on some devices but if you want to use them you can specify ->subtree for the active tabobject.

Parameters
$tabrows : array<string|int, mixed>

An array of rows where each row is an array of tab objects

$selected : string = null

The id of the selected tab (whatever row it's on)

$inactive : array<string|int, mixed> = null

An array of ids of inactive tabs that are not selectable.

$activated : array<string|int, mixed> = null

An array of ids of other tabs that are currently activated

$return : bool = false

If true output is returned rather then echo'd

Return values
string —

HTML output if $return was set to true.

Parameters
$level : int

one of the DEBUG_* constants

$debugdisplay : bool = null
Return values
mixed —

debugging()

weblib.php : 3291

Standard Debugging Function

debugging([string $message = '' ][, int $level = DEBUG_NORMAL ][, array<string|int, mixed> $backtrace = null ]) : bool

Returns true if the current site debugging settings are equal or above specified level. If passed a parameter it will emit a debugging notice similar to trigger_error(). The routing of notices is controlled by $CFG->debugdisplay eg use like this:

  1. debugging('a normal debug notice');
  2. debugging('something really picky', DEBUG_ALL);
  3. debugging('annoying debug message only for developers', DEBUG_DEVELOPER);
  4. if (debugging()) { perform extra debugging operations (do not use print or echo) }

In code blocks controlled by debugging() (such as example 4) any output should be routed via debugging() itself, or the lower-level trigger_error() or error_log(). Using echo or print will break XHTML JS and HTTP headers.

It is also possible to define NO_DEBUG_DISPLAY which redirects the message to error_log.

Parameters
$message : string = ''

a message to print

$level : int = DEBUG_NORMAL

the level at which this debugging statement should show

$backtrace : array<string|int, mixed> = null

use different backtrace

Return values
bool —

print_location_comment()

weblib.php : 3354

Outputs a HTML comment to the browser.

print_location_comment(string $file, int $line[, bool $return = false ]) : string|void

print_location_comment(FILE, LINE);

Parameters

$line : int
$return : bool = false

Return values

get_formatted_help_string()

weblib.php : 3764

Get the value of a help string fully prepared for display in the current language.

get_formatted_help_string(string $identifier, string $component[, bool $ajax = false ][, string|object|array<string|int, mixed> $a = null ]) : stdClass
Parameters
$identifier : string

The identifier of the string to search for.

$component : string

The module the string is associated with.

$ajax : bool = false

Whether this help is called from an AJAX script. This is used to influence text formatting and determines which format to output the doclink in.

$a : string|object|array<string|int, mixed> = null

An object, string or number that can be used within translation strings

Return values
stdClass —

An object containing:

  • heading: Any heading that there may be for this help string.
  • text: The wiki-formatted help string.
  • doclink: An object containing a link, the linktext, and any additional CSS classes to apply to that link. Only present if $ajax = false.
  • completedoclink: A text representation of the doclink. Only present if $ajax = true.

profiling_export_runs()

xhprof_moodle.php : 531

Export profiling runs to a .mpr (moodle profile runs) file.

profiling_export_runs(array<string|int, mixed> $runids, string $file) : bool

This function gets an array of profiling runs (array of runids) and saves a .mpr file into destination for ulterior handling.

Format of .mpr files: mpr files are simple zip packages containing these files: - moodle_profiling_runs.xml: Metadata about the information exported. Contains some header information (version and release of moodle, database, git hash - if available, date of export...) and a list of all the runids included in the export.

  • runid.xml: One file per each run detailed in the main file, containing the raw dump of the given runid in the profiling table.

Possible improvement: Start storing some extra information in the profiling table for each run (moodle version, database, git hash...).

Parameters
$runids : array<string|int, mixed>

list of runids to be exported.

$file : string

filesystem fullpath to destination .mpr file.

Return values
bool —

the mpr file has been successfully exported (true) or no (false).

profiling_import_runs()

xhprof_moodle.php : 579

filesystem fullpath to target .mpr file.

$commentprefix : string = ''

prefix to add to the comments of all the imported runs.

Return values

the mpr file has been successfully imported (true) or no (false).

xmlize()

xmlize.php : 240

XML parsing function calles into class.

xmlize(string $data[, int $whitespace = 1 ][, string $encoding = 'UTF-8' ][, bool $reporterrors = false ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Note: Used by xml element handler as callback.

Parameters
$data : string

the XML source to parse.

$whitespace : int = 1

If set to 1 allows the parser to skip "space" characters in xml document. Default is 1

$encoding : string = 'UTF-8'

Specify an OUTPUT encoding. If not specified, it defaults to UTF-8.

$reporterrors : bool = false

if set to true, then a exception will be thrown if the XML is not well-formed. Otherwise errors are ignored.

Return values
array<string|int, mixed> —

representation of the parsed XML.
